member.name: T:VRage.Components.IMyComponentAggregate
member.summary: When creating a new aggregate component type, derive from this interface so that you can use extension methods AddComponent and RemoveComponent

member.summary: Removes from list, but doesn't change ownership

member.name: M:VRage.Components.MyComponentBase.SetContainer(VRage.Components.MyComponentContainer)
member.summary: Sets the container of this component. Note that the component is not added to the container here! Therefore, use MyComponentContainer.Add(...) method and it will in turn call this method. Actually, you should seldom have the need to call this method yourself.
member.param: The new container of the component

member.summary: Gets called after the container of this component changes

member.summary: Gets called before the removal of this component from a container

member.summary: Tells the component container serializer whether this component should be saved

member.summary: This cannot be named Container to not conflict with the definition of Container in MyEntityComponentBase.

member.summary: Returns if any component is assignable from type

Identifier for the parent hierarchy.
This is should be reliably unique within a hierarchy level but only usable by the parent.

member.name: P:VRage.MyEntityIdentifier.AllocationSuspended
member.summary: Freezes allocating entity ids. This is important, because during load, no entity cannot allocate new id, because it could allocate id which already has entity which will be loaded soon.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Definitions.MyDefinitionBase.Postprocess
member.summary:
Override this in case you want to do some postprocessing of the definition before the game starts.
Postprocess is useful if you want to process the definition before the game begins,
but you only want to do it when all the definitions are loaded and merged.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Definitions.MyDefinitionBase.DisplayNameText
member.summary: Use this property when showing name in GUI instead of DisplayName. This takes into account more complex name construction.

member.name: P:Sandbox.Definitions.MyDefinitionBase.DescriptionText
member.summary: Use this property when showing description in GUI, as it takes into account more complex description construction.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Common.ObjectBuilders.Definitions.BlueprintItem.Amount
member.summary: Amount of item required or produced. For discrete objects this refers to pieces. For ingots and ore, this refers to volume in m^3.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Definitions.MyDefinitionId
member.summary: Prefer getting definition ID using object builder used to create the item. If you have automatic rifle, in its Init method create new MyDefinitionId using TypeId and SubtypeName of object builder. Do not write specific values in code, as data comes from XML and if those change, code needs to change as well.

member.name: M:Sandbox.Definitions.MyDefinitionId.GetHashCodeLong
member.summary: Safer hash code. It is unique in more situations than GetHashCode would be, but it may still require full check.

member.summary: This will search through definitions to find if Default Components contains the searched component either as BuilderType, InstanceType, or ComponentType
member.param: Name of the type to search for in defined default components
member.returns: true if is defined component with the matching BuilderType, InstanceType or ComponentType

member.name: F:Sandbox.Common.ObjectBuilders.Definitions.MyAutorotateMode.OneDirection
member.summary: When block has mount points only on one side, it will autorotate so that side is touching the surface. Otherwise, full range of rotations is allowed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Common.ObjectBuilders.Definitions.MyAutorotateMode.OppositeDirections
member.summary: When block has mount points only on two sides and those sides are opposite each other (eg. Top and Bottom), it will autorotate so that one of these sides is touching the surface. Otherwise, full range of rotations is allowed.

member.name: F:Sandbox.Common.ObjectBuilders.Definitions.MyAutorotateMode.FirstDirection
member.summary: When block has mountpoint on at least one side, it will autorotate so that this side is touching the surface. Otherwise, full range of rotations is allowed.

member.name: T:Sandbox.Common.ObjectBuilders.Definitions.MyGlobalEventTypeEnum
member.summary: Defines the event type. Each event type has its assigned handler method and data class type. Multiple event definitions can have the same event type.

member.name: T:Medieval.ObjectBuilders.Definitions.MyObjectBuilder_LockBlockDefinition
member.summary: Definition for one small grid lock block (used inside large block as mechanical subblock).

members.member:
Important!
Due to the geometry in question the slope is stored as the cosine (used in dot product).
Meanwhile the dot product for the latitude yields the cosine of the modulus of the compliment of our angle. This means after the maths are done that what we have is the *sine*, so the latitude is stored as the sine.
Rule group defines a material mappable set of surface rules.

When the range is an angle this method changes it to the cosines of the angle.
The angle is expected to be in degrees.
Also beware that cosine is a decreasing function in [0,90], for that reason the minimum and maximum are swaped.

When the range is an angle this method changes it to the sines of the angle.
The angle is expected to be in degrees.

Reflective because it can be reflected to the oposite range.
Structs not inheriting from structs is stupid.

When the range is an angle this method changes it to the cosines of the angle.
The angle is expected to be in degrees.
Also beware that cosine is a decreasing function in [0,90], for that reason the minimum and maximum are swaped.

When the range is an angle this method changes it to the sines of the angle.
The angle is expected to be in degrees.
